data.title: Salute to Summer Concert
data.text:
Save the date for Salute to Summer,

THE summer concert celebration!

Riley Green, T.I., and DJ Rock

perform live at Fort Stewart

on Donovan Field

on June 18!

Gates Open at 3:00 p.m.

Concert grounds opens & pre-party with DJ Rock starts at 5:30 p.m.

Concert starts at 7:30 p.m. and ends at 11:00 p.m.

This event is free and open to the public!

Please note: Fort Stewart is an active military base and guests, guests' vehicles, and guests' items may be subject to random search to ensure the safety of our community. Installation access is at the discretion of the Commander based on health and protection protocols.

Riley Green

About Riley Green

Website | Facebook | Instagram

Riley Green has been compelling Country music fans to raise a drink, shed a tear, and, above all, celebrate where they are from, since first releasing his self-titled EP in 2018. His songs like the No. 1 PLATINUM hit "There Was This Girl," the 2X-PLATINUM-certified heart-tugger "I Wish Grandpas Never Died" (which he performed live at the 55th ACM Awards), and his chart-topping collab with Thomas Rhett, "Half of Me," have made Riley synonymous with what Country music does best: making listeners feel something with his no-gimmick, relatable writing and classic feel.

As an avid sports fan, former athlete (Jacksonville State University quarterback) and outdoorsman, Riley is riding a wave of success after being named the Academy of Country Music's 2020 New Male Artist of the Year, a former MusicRow Breakout Artist of the Year, a CMT "Listen Up Artist," and one of CRS's 2020 New Faces.

Now playing to an average of 65,000 fans each night serving as direct support for Morgan Allen and Luke Combs in 2023, Green headlined the Rock The South festival and is selling out his own headlining shows. Combs joins Riley on his current Top 30-and-climbing single "Different 'Round Here (Ft. Luke Combs)," the title track to Riley's 2019 debut album that he re-recorded with Combs after seeing how fans connected to it.

His new album Ain't My Last Rodeo, produced by Dan Huff, is more of the signature Riley Green fans have come to know and love from the good ol' boy who still lives in his hometown of Jacksonville, AL.

T.I.

About T.I.

Website | Facebook | Instagram

Aside from his contributions in entertainment including 11 hit albums, multiple Grammy's, Billboard BET and American Music Awards, countless blockbuster movies and top-rated television shows including ATL, VH-1's T.I. and Tiny: The Family Hustle, American Gangster, Marvel's Ant-Man, and made his 2023 directorial debut with his 100% independent comedy "Da 'Partments," to name a few, Tip "T.I." Harris has made an indelible mark on the world of business.

He is an artist, entrepreneur, and activist who has amassed a business empire to include a record label, a 10-year-old clothing line (Akoo, which stands for "A King of Oneself"), a real estate holdings company, production company, non-profit organization (Us or Else), owner/founder of Trap Music Museum, co-owner of Bankhead Seafood, owner of Super Sound Studios, investor, and much more.

Harris served on the Mayor of Atlanta's Transition Team, where he focused on policy and legislation; and currently serves on the Reimagining Atlanta Task Force, aimed at creating restorative practices and a community-driven approach to addressing incarceration. He has been recognized most recently as a thought leader at the United States Capitol and during the Operation Hope, as well as during the Congressional Black Caucus, and Forbes Magazine business conferences. His community focus is around driving economic mobility and equity in vulnerable, underserved communities. Harris was also awarded the first-ever "Voice of the Culture" award by ASCAP and is the host of a #1 rated podcast, expediTIously with Tip "T.I." Harris.

T.I. is also currently working on two albums, titled Kiss the King and Kill the King. The first single from Kiss the King released on November 3, "Vacay" featuring South African artist Kamo Mphela.

DJ Rock

About DJ Rock

Website | Facebook

For the past 20 years, DJ Rock has performed for crowds in premiere venues throughout North America and Mexico. As an open format DJ, he is well versed in all music formats, spinning everything from country to hip hop to rock to today's top 40 hits. He's worked alongside artists like Luke Bryan, Snoop Dogg, Florida Georgia Line, Gucci Mane, John Legend, Jennifer Lopez, Blake Shelton, and more. Rock has also appeared at some of the biggest-selling music festivals including Off The Rails, Rock The South, Route 91, and Tortuga. Rock just finished Luke Bryan's "Country On Tour" which played over 40 shows last year, in addition to 13 stadiums, before wrapping the end of October.

Timeline

3:00 pm: Gate 3 opens

3:00 pm – 8:00 pm: Fun Zone (Holding Zone) opens​

Food vendors​

Beer sales​

Interactive games​

5:30 pm: Concert field open​

5:30 pm – 7:15 pm: DJ​

7:15 pm: National Anthem​

7:20 pm: CG remarks​

7:30 pm – 8:30 pm: T.I.

9:00 pm – 10:30 pm: Riley Green

*Please note times may vary.

General Information

In the event of an emergency:

Call 911

Directorate of Emergency Services (DES): (912)767-4264

The low country heat can be brutal at times. Please stay hydrated with plenty of water, apply bug spray as needed, and don't forget the sunscreen!

Gate Access & Directions to Donovan Field

Gate 3 will open at 3:00 pm for general public access. The pin below is Gate 3.

For Parking

General Parking

Those without DOD ID Cards will have access to get onto Fort Stewart through Gate 3, off of Old Sunbury Road. Drivers must present a photo ID at the gate. A reminder that any vehicle coming onto post is subject to be searched. General Public signs will be available to follow.

DOD ID Cardholders

If you are a DOD ID Cardholder and choose to enter post through Gate 3, please be aware that you will be parking in the General Parking Area AND exiting through Gate 3, regardless of DOD ID Cardholder status. If you would like to park in the DOD ID Cardholder parking area, there will be alternate route signs to direct you. Please be aware that to enter the road, 100% ID Checks will be in place. Gate 5 (Highway 144) and Gate 1 (Main Gate) will also be available to DOD ID Cardholders for entry. DOD ID Cardholder Parking signs will be available to follow.

Additional parking will be made available in the event that the concert field parking is full. Patrons will follow concert signage to additional parking locations.

Parking Map

For Parking

General Parking

Those without DOD ID Cards will have access to get onto Fort Stewart through Gate 3, off of Old Sunbury Road. Drivers must present a photo ID at the gate. A reminder that any vehicle coming onto post is subject to be searched. General Public signs will be available to follow.

DOD ID Cardholders

If you are a DOD ID Cardholder and choose to enter post through Gate 3, please be aware that you will be parking in the General Parking Area AND exiting through Gate 3, regardless of DOD ID Cardholder status. If you would like to park in the DOD ID Cardholder parking area, there will be alternate route signs to direct you. Please be aware that to enter the road, 100% ID Checks will be in place. Gate 5 (Highway 144) and Gate 1 (Main Gate) will also be available to DOD ID Cardholders for entry. DOD ID Cardholder Parking signs will be available to follow.

Additional parking will be made available in the event that the concert field parking is full. Patrons will follow concert signage to additional parking locations.

What to Bring & Prohibited Items

Low country heat can be brutal at times. Please stay hydrated with plenty of water, apply bug spray as needed, and don't forget the sunscreen.

PROHIBITED ITEMS LIST:

Outside food or drinks (exception: food/drink for infants)

Glass or cans

Weapons

Explosives

Tents

Umbrellas

Noise makers

Illegal substances

Flash photography and recording devices (exception: cell phone cameras; official media)

Flash lights and laser pointers

Drones

Fireworks

Although we love our four-legged fur babies, we're going to ask that you leave them at home. Service dogs are welcome.

Please note: Fort Stewart is an active military base and guests, guests' vehicles, and guests' items may be subject to random search to ensure the safety of our community. Installation access is at the discretion of the Commander based on health and protection protocols.

Attire

As we gear up for an amazing night on Fort Stewart, please keep in mind that the Salute to Summer concert takes place on a military base.

For the safety and comfort of all attendees, we kindly ask that everyone dresses appropriately.

Attire depicting illicit drug activity/paraphernalia, illegal activity, political messaging, derogatory, or sexually suggestive content may result in being denied entry to the event.

Fun Zone

The Fun Zone (holding zone) will include food vendors​, beer sales​, the Marne Market, and interactive games.

Games will include:

Rock Wall

Inflatable Roaring Zip Line

Inflatable Mechanical Bull

Mini Golf

Marne Market

The Salute to Summer Concert will have a variety of vendors at our Marne Market, located inside of the Fun Zone. Vendors include both home-based businesses and SFRGs.

Facility Closures

Due to the upcoming concert and Juneteenth holiday (6/17-6/19), some of our facility hours will change at Fort Stewart and Hunter MWR facilities.

Click here for a list of facility closures/reduced hours.

Please note that 24/7 access will be available at Jordan, Johnson, and Tominac Fitness center.

Other Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

Food & Drink Questions:

Can I bring a water bottle?

Unfortunately, no outside water bottles (plastic, refillable, etc.) will be allowed into the venue. There will, however, be water bottles available for purchase at the event.

Can I bring outside food and/or drinks?

No outside food or drinks are allowed with the exception of food for infants/toddlers and those with special dietary needs or restrictions.

What kind of food will be available?

We will have over 30 different food vendors represented. Food options will vary in flavor profiles and cuisines.

See list of food vendors in Food Truck Vendors tab.

Access Questions

Is the event open to everyone?

Yes. The event is open to the general public. If you do not have installation access, you will use Gate 3 (Access Point on Old Sunbury Road) starting at 3:00 pm to enter Fort Stewart and follow the signs to the General Public Parking.

Please be aware that if you use Gate 3 after 3:00 pm on June 18, you will ONLY have access to the General Public Parking and will have to exit using Gate 3 as well.

Do I need to register for the event?

No registration is necessary. You do not need a wristband. This is a FREE event.

What is the timeline of events?

3:00 pm: Gate 3 opens

3:00 pm – 8:00 pm: Fun Zone (holding zone) opens​

Food vendors​

Beer sales​

Interactive games​

7:30 pm – 8:30 pm: T.I.

9:00 pm – 10:30 pm: Riley Green

5:30 pm: Concert field open​

5:30 pm – 7:15 pm: DJ​

7:15 pm: National Anthem​

7:20 pm: CG remarks​

*Please note times may vary.

What should I bring to the event?

Donovan Field is a grassy field, so we suggest bringing lawn chairs or foldable camping chairs as well as blankets. Bring sunscreen, a hat, and bug spray. Bring cash and/or card if you'd like to purchase food and beverages. If you have kids that will be enjoying our inflatables, we suggest making sure they have socks because of how hot the bounce houses get in the sun. On top of all else, bring a great attitude ready to jam, sing, dance, and celebrate our great nation.

What can I NOT bring to the event?

Do not bring outside food or drink. For caveats, please see the food section of our FAQ.

Do not bring large items that would obstruct someone else's view such as umbrellas, banners and tents.

Firearms or weapons of any nature are NOT allowed.

Flash photography is NOT allowed as well as recording devices (but cell phones are allowed)!

No flash lights or laser pointers

For a complete list of prohibited items, please see our Prohibited Items tab.
